intro: Haplophyton crooksii, commonly known as the Crook's liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its leafy, thalloid structure and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a simple morphology with no true roots, stems, or leaves, and it reproduces via spores. It is often found growing on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
